abstract_summ: The large outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) that started in Wuhan, China has now spread to many countries worldwide.There is a current worldwide outbreak of the novel coronavirus Covid-19 (coronavirus disease 2019; the pathogen called SARS-CoV-2; previously 2019-nCoV), which originated from Wuhan in China and has now spread to 6 continents including 66 countries, as of 24:00 on March 2, 2020.A new coronavirus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2, was first discovered in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.The novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has grown to be a global public health emergency since patients were first detected in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.At this stage, preparedness, transparency, and sharing of information are crucial to risk assessments and beginning outbreak control activities.
title_summ: Stem cell-based therapy for coronavirus disease 2019.Understanding the Mosaic of COVID-19: A Review of the Ongoing CrisisFirst Pediatric Case of Coronavirus Disease 2019 in KoreaThe SARS-CoV-2 outbreak: What we knowFocus on a 2019-novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2)
title_abstract_phrases: The SARS-CoV-2 outbreak: What we knowThere is a current worldwide outbreak of the novel coronavirus Covid-19 (coronavirus disease 2019; the pathogen called SARS-CoV-2; previously 2019-nCoV), which originated from Wuhan in China and has now spread to 6 continents including 66 countries, as of 24:00 on March 2, 2020.First Pediatric Case of Coronavirus Disease 2019 in KoreaThe large outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) that started in Wuhan, China has now spread to many countries worldwide.Focus on a 2019-novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2)A new coronavirus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2, was first discovered in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.Stem cell-based therapy for coronavirus disease 2019.The novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has grown to be a global public health emergency since patients were first detected in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.There are a total of seven types of coronaviruses that infect humans: 229E and NL63 are the alpha coronaviruses; OC43, HKU1, MERS-CoV, and SARS-CoV are beta coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV-2 or COVID-19 is a novel coronavirus.
